org.transitime.core

Class ServiceUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.core.ServiceUtils

  • public class ServiceUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    For working with service types, such as determining serviceId or appropriate block to use for a given epoch time.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

        public int getDayOfWeek(java.util.Date epochTime)

        Parameters:

      • getServiceIdsForDay

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getServiceIdsForDay(java.util.Date epochTime)
        Determines list of current service IDs for the specified time. These service IDs designate which block assignments are currently active.

        Uses already read in calendars, but does a good number of calculations so still a bit expensive.

        Parameters:
        epochTime - The current time that determining service IDs for
        Returns:
        List of service IDs that are active for the specified time.

      • getServiceIdsForDay

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getServiceIdsForDay(long epochTime)
        Determines list of current service IDs for the specified time. These service IDs designate which block assignments are currently active.

        Uses already read in calendars, but does a good number of calculations so still a bit expensive.

        Parameters:
        epochTime - The current time that determining service IDs for
        Returns:
        List of service IDs that are active for the specified time.

      • getServiceIds

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getServiceIds(java.util.Date epochTime)
        Determines list of current service IDs for the specified time. If it is before the java property minutesIntoMorningToIncludePreviousServiceIds then the service IDs for the previous day will also be included. This way will get the proper service IDs even for blocks that started the previous day. Important for late night service. These service IDs designate which block assignments are currently active.

        Uses already read in calendars, but does a good number of calculations so still a bit expensive.

        Parameters:
        epochTime - The current time that determining service IDs for
        Returns:
        List of service IDs that are active for the specified time, includes ones for previous day if epochTime specifies it is early in the morning.

      • getServiceIds

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getServiceIds(long epochTime)
        Determines list of current service IDs for the specified time. If it is before the java property minutesIntoMorningToIncludePreviousServiceIds then the service IDs for the previous day will also be included. This way will get the proper service IDs even for blocks that started the previous day. Important for late night service. These service IDs designate which block assignments are currently active.

        Uses already read in calendars, but does a good number of calculations so still a bit expensive.

        Parameters:
        epochTime - The current time that determining service IDs for
        Returns:
        List of service IDs that are active for the specified time, includes ones for previous day if epochTime specifies it is early in the morning.
